replies.body: So {{champion:12}} and {{champion:106}} are not considered vastayan?
Volibear is a part of a species called the Ursine I believe and Im pretty sure Alistar is just a minotaur.

Yeah, Volibear is a part of a tribe in Frejlord and Alistar was a minotaur from the barrier that was captured by Noxus. Both are no were near Ionia. My concern is why Rengar is there since I thought he was from the Kumungu Jungle
he is but he was raised by a human and he never knew his real parents I guess riot is saying that they were vastayan.

In some of the readings and voice lines from our two new champions, I can almost assuredly assure u that {{champion:12}} and {{champion:106}} as well as other champs like {{champion:203}} and any yordles are a part of a different vastayan tribe or race, but maybe not the same as {{champion:497}} and {{champion:498}} are.

Kindred is absolutely not a Vastayan under any circumstance; they are the concept of death. Not a race of any kind. Yordles are extremely unlikely to be retconned into Vastayans. Alistar comes from a minotaur tribe in the great barrier (between shurima and demacia), but he and others may be retconned into Vastaya.

I don't actually agree with that definition of kindred... I think kindred is really complicated. To me, her lore is in need of rewriting. So, how can she be an essence of death, and also had been a human...that turned into a lamb and a wolf? If she was not at some point alive...and died with her kindred spirit so to speak...which is why I think someone needs to clarify in riot...what exactly is going on with kindred. Is she actually the essence of life or death on the battlefield? Or is that what she became...as a legend. The actuality of what she is has yet to be explained in my opinion. I think, she was a restless spirit that died too soon, and somehow became a vengeful spirit...that hunts for revenge purposes. With, the husband or boyfriend who killed her prematurely in a crime of passion...like a murder suicide. Whichh does seem to be explained somewhat in the lore of magga...I don't know though? which is why I think riot should clarify what the hell kindred and wolf are...and if there's anything out there like them or not.

They werent ever a man, Riot themselves said the story they tell about the man who split him self in two, isn't their origin story, riot confirmed this was literally just a story, that Runeterra's inhabitants tell to explain kindreds origin, althought it is not their origin, like we humans used to make storys that became the greek mythos and the norse mythos, the storys were created to give an explanation to something that couldn't be explained at the time with logic. That's all that thing is, a story. As far as we know, Kindred is Death and is and always have been kindred since the dawn of existant
And what is twitch??? A massive deformed rat or a vastaya that was corrupted by zaun maybe?
Twitch is actually an zaunian lab experiment that escaped. His lore in the game kinda explains it vaugly

like squeeglepaps said {{champion:106}} is Ursine which is from Freljord. I don't know squat about {{champion:12}} and Vastaya are from Ionia. if i'm not mistaken, cause i basically skimmed it, all Vastaya have some human-like physical trait to them
they come from ionia originally but vastayah can live all over. nami's fish people live near mt targon
where my Cosmic Blade Master Yi? {{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
Yi isn't Vastayan...

But he's VastaYIan

ah hah 
im not sorry

{{champion:33}} You guys have NO idea. Riot forgot about me 3 seasons ago. Might as well be {{champion:6}}

I just want a new skin for {{champion:420}}
On the subject, where's this guy's *glorious evolution* {{champion:112}}

I read that in a russian accent and laughed for a full minute.

what is wrong with me...
Udyr? Elise? Fizz? Kennen? Nidalee? Soraka? Swain? Trundle? Twitch?

Udyr is Freljordian, Elise is Noxian, Fizz is from around Bilgewater, Kennen was born in Bandle City, Nidalee is from Kumungu Jungle, Soraka used to be a celestial being (might change cause of the Warwick lore change), Swain is Noxian, Trundle is Freljordian, and Twitch is from a scientifically advanced area like Zaun or Piltover.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Elise is from the shadow isles i thought?

no, look at her story, she used to be a wealthy and prestigious individual in Noxus. I can see where you thought she was from the Isles though, but on that note she does have interactions with Vilemaw on Twisted Treeline, so maybe thats where your confusion is?

Udyr and Swain both stole Vastayan blood to get the powers they have according to the new lore, Fizz and Kennan are yordels, Soraka was previously a celestial, but like stated will probs get changed with the Warwick lore. Twitch was a Zuan experiment, but may be getting lumped in with yordels with new lore. Trundle is a troll =D. Elise traded her soul to some spider god to be eternally youthful (hint hint Vilemaw interactions)

twitch is a rat experiment from zaun, trundle is from the freljord, swain is noxas, soraka is a diety, kennen is from bandle city, fizz is from the ocean, Elise is from the shadow isles and udyr is human. idk about nidalee

{{champion:76}}  is also human she was brought to the jungle by her parents who died early and was raised by cougars (which seems unlikely since cougars prefer mountains vs rain forests but hey whatever) anyways she is a shapeshifter thanks to "absorbing raw magical power"
Shapeshifters are a type of vastayan.
Not necessarily, vastayans are a type of shapeshifter. After all, Shyvanna can shapeshift, but she's explicitly a half-dragon, and has nothing to do with vastayans.

Cougars live in jungles in South America and Africa, where they are known as panthers and jaguars.

By the way, there really isn't any point in calling pumas, panthers, cougars, jaguars, and mountain lions different names. It would be like calling humans with brown hair a totally different species from humans with blond hair.

Mountain lions/cougars/pumas are not the same thing as jaguars/Panthers, it is nothing like hair color in humans, they are very different physiologically speaking. 
The mountain lion's genus and species are Puma Concolour, while the jaguar of south America is Panthera Onca, they can't even interbreed with one another they're so different.
Some people do refer to mountain lion's as panthers in certain parts of the U.S. but it is generally considered improper as the name panther refers specifically to members of the Panthera genus.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cougar

Source for cougar common names there is reportedly about 49 different names for the same cat
Shapeshifting is a common trait for Vastayans. I wouldn't be surprised if {{champion:76}} 's lore was changed in the near future. As is stands, however, {{champion:76}} isn't Vastayan (sadly).
Why talk about Vastayans when we can talk about {{champion:119}}
